website_summaries.verdict: This melodic turtle is a fun way to introduce little ones to the magical world music. With multiple instrument buttons, lights, and 2 modes to explore, it's suitable for both tinies and toddlers.
pros: Features 8 classical melodies and a variety of instrument buttons, including piano, drum, cello, harp, and xylophone
With two modes, children can play either classical music at the press of a button or “compose” their own melodies by activating or deactivating one instrument at a time
Available in multiple sea animal designs
cons: Some parents feel the lights are a little too bright
Shifts and moves with enthusiastic button-pushing

customer_reviews.title: An educational toy he can learn and grow with.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how long the battery will last, we just received it. What I can tell you is how much my 6 month old grandson and I really enjoy this educational toy. Of course, he's trying to eat the octopus's hat. LOL everything goes in the mouth
customer_reviews.author: laurie shea

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. The first finally crapped out after going through 3 kids using it and throwing it around, and 4 moves. As babies they were all absolutely delighted with it, so much so that I bought another one for my 4th baby who is on the way. Very durable. Batteries last a long time. Has 2 different modes for instruments and songs, and a volume control. Helps to keep baby entertained while you need to do other things. I used to give it to them for playtime in their crib or play yard. Songs are not unpleasant to listen to, unlike some other baby toys. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. E.

customer_reviews.title: Fun & lasts for years!
customer_reviews.text: This has lasted through multiple kids and they have all been drawn to it because of the lights and music. I like that it has 2 modes - conducting (for toddlers) and simple songs (for babies). I do wish the full songs would finish playing when the buttons are hit; babies tend to hit the lit up buttons over and over and the song changes every time. It is great that the lights correspond to the beat of the songs.
customer_reviews.author: Healthy FitMom

customer_reviews.title: Great musicial you, speaker is weak
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this turtle for our new baby girl as one of her first toys. She really loved it from the first day on and at 5 months now she loves pushing all the buttons and even moving the turtle around. I was disappointed to see some of the paint actually coming off and that the sound seems to be getting worse ( sounded much clearer when we first got it) The songs are nice and in typical Baby Einstein fashion.The different modes are fun for everyone to play around whit, while they interact with baby.
customer_reviews.author: The Goss Family

customer_reviews.title: Not really toddler proof
customer_reviews.text: While I LOVE this item & it seems to work entertain our little granddaughter... sadly one small drop & the head snapped off on the first day she was playing with it. I think that toys that are marketed to toddlers really need to be built with 'toddlers' in mind they do tend to drop things with their little hands. Amazon customer service was excellent & it was no problem to return. It's just the durability of this item that was not satisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: LLL

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy for older babies
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old is currently playing with this toy but still can't figure out how it works. He just bashed the buttons for 5 minutes then becomes bored. It has two settings, one that plays a new song any time you hit any button and one that stays on one song while you add or remove key instruments using the side shell buttons. My only complaint is that even when my little guy gets older the fact that the legs are hard plastic means he really has to reach for the buttons if this is on the ground between his legs.
customer_reviews.author: PrincessKateTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Nice music, and durable toy.
customer_reviews.text: I work with special needs youngsters and this turtle is EVERYONE’S favorite and is requested daily. If allowed, they would carry it around the entire day listening to the soothing music. Fortunately the lights and music are not at all annoying, like many electronic toys, so if the buttons get pushed repeatedly I don’t mind. Our Neptune(s) (yes, we have three) are super durable too!!! They get dropped, stepped on and rolled over by wheelchairs and they still work great!
customer_reviews.author: Martha Miller-Hall

customer_reviews.title: My 7 month old loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old daughter loves it! It was better quality than I expected. Some people seem to be confused about what the painted circles are? The black and white circles are his eyes and the blue circles are his cheeks. I like the size of it, it's just the right size to bring for travel in the car or on a plane. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AMogensen

customer_reviews.title: Favorite musical toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with patients in pediatric physical therapy and it is a huge hit. Does topple over when grabbed by little hands, but not as easily as some other similar toys. Can be used during tummy time or in sitting. Even though the "head" doesn't technically do anything, it wobbles a bit which is apparently still enough fun because infants bat at it over and over again (or try to chew on it).
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Was sold a used/opened toy
customer_reviews.text: The packaging for this toy was upside down in the delivery box. I grabbed it from the bottom to pull it out and found that the zip ties were all cut and the toy was not fastened to the packaging whatsoever. If this was for myself it would not be a big deal but it is something I am donating to a toy drive, in which toys must be new, and unopened. This is disappointing, I will have to now buy zip ties to reattach it myself for donation.
customer_reviews.author: KristenAlexis

customer_reviews.title: What an Amazing Toy
customer_reviews.text: YOU CANNOT BEAT THE PRICE when you consider the quality and ability to keep your child entertained. Wow. So glad i bought this. I use it practically every day. I bought for my 2.5month old baby and he is so captivated by it. Great for tummy time and hand coordination exercise. Also, my kid loves beating this and setting it off with his feet. He gets a real kick out of it. And its such a versatile toy i know my kid will be aying with it for years to come. Fun bright engaging cute and colorful
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy! It has fun colors and lights! The songs are classic and upbeat and there are so many different songs that aren’t annoying. Lol It hold my 5 month olds attention and the buttons are easy to push. I bought it hoping it will help enhance tummy time. It has a feature where you can push one instrument button at a time and it will add in each instrument to the song. It’s fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant Music Toy...one for all to enjoy
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the music that comes in this toy. My 6 month old grandson was fascinated for hours as it only takes a slight touch of hand to make the music. I would definitely buy it again. My only "less than thrilled" is the fact that the speaker is on the bottom so it can be hard to hear if its sitting flat. Truly a wonderful toy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The sounds aren't harsh or tinny like a lot of kids toys
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 6 months old, and loves the lights and music that this makes. She also likes smacking the legs since they wobble a bit. The sounds aren't harsh or tinny like a lot of kids toys, and there are two volume levels to choose from so it's not always overpoweringly loud. I love that the songs are complex instead of just having one melody, and they are classics that she will be able to recognize if she hears the "real" versions. She isn't old enough to understand the mode where you take out/put in instruments, but I'm excited for when that time comes, too!
customer_reviews.author: Miriam C

customer_reviews.title: My Grandson’s Favorite Toy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a Christmas present for my 4 month old grandson. He is now 9 months old and my daughter-n-law tells me it is still his favorite toy and they can’t go anywhere without it. She said he has gotten many new toys that he will play with for a little while, but always goes back to this one. Even with older siblings playing with it, it still looks aNd works as good as the day they got it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favourite purchases for my baby! My family is big into music and strong believers that music is good for your baby, both emotionally and developmentally. I love the selections this toy has loaded onto it, and apparently my baby does, too! He will press the button to cycle through until he hears his favourites and starts bouncing up and down to dance to them. I bought this for my baby when he was about 7 months old. He's now going on 9 months and plays with this every day. I would definitely purchase this again!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Such a great find!!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old absolutely loves this toy! It's perfect. It's easy for babies to operate and interact with, has great sounds, and is totally interactive. The sounds all depend on the buttons selected, and change with each input, allowing for a wide variety of songs and soinds to help keep baby entertained. I'm so happy I found this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Elski

customer_reviews.title: Not a recommended toy
customer_reviews.text: This was a very boring toy. I returned it the same day it was delivered. My son usually loves stuff similar to this but it only had basically one song, or what sounds like 1 song no matter what button you push. That's all it does. I thought the circle on its head would have been at least a mirror or another button.... nope! It's literally a painted circle. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Therese McPherson

customer_reviews.title: Slightly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have read the reviews more closely, but I trusted the brand. Disappointed in the fact that the piano keys can’t be pushed and the top of the drum is fabric. I like the music, but the toy itself definitely wasn’t what I was expecting. We just got it so I am hoping my daughter will like it better than I do.
customer_reviews.author: KAD

customer_reviews.title: The BEST tummy time toy
customer_reviews.text: Our baby hated tummy time and was not interested in rattles or high contrast pictures or mirrors or any of the usual tummy time toys. But this toy was perfect--lights and music to grab attention, and buttons that are easy to push. Baby also liked that the head can bobble back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: This is such a neat and educational toy! I love that it teaches babies about classical music, colors, and instruments! There are two different settings that allow either continuous music or allow babies to make their own. Even my toddler likes to play with it. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Prompt seller
customer_reviews.text: I am a nurse and had a patient with this toy. I always loved it, and he was always so fascinated with it. Now that I have my own, I ordered it. The first one I received had no sound, but the seller promptly sent a replacement before I even sent the malfunctioning toy back. Very happy with my purchase and the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few times usages
customer_reviews.text: I just started using this for play time with my 4 MO and it is not working properly after a few times using it. It seams liek its stock. No music would play. Buttons stopped working. My baby hasn't even touched it yet. Very disappointed. Baby Einstein product are usually good but this one didn't work.for us
customer_reviews.author: Anita S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing toy but heavy for a baby who is not crawling yet.
customer_reviews.text: My son is 4.5months and his thumb is always in his month except for food. But this was the only toy yet that got him struggling between his thumb and the toy. It was amazing to watch his excitement. My only issue is that the toy is too heavy so we have a hard time figuring where to place it for him to play without me having to hold it or putting it on his feet for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: AmazingG

customer_reviews.title: Great tummy time distraction
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my kiddos favorite toys. They love playing with him! We got this around 6 months old and at 9 months, they’re still obsessed. It speaks in 3 languages and alternates between colors, objects and songs. It’s a great toy for tummy time especially!
customer_reviews.author: Nagnot

customer_reviews.title: Too quiet for a toy.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help my son during tummy time. He’s 3 mo old, but doesn’t seem interested yet. I personally think it’s because the volume isn’t as loud as it should. I’ll be the one and only crazy parent who complains of a noisy toy being too quiet. I just wish it would be loud enough to get my sons attention. It’s not
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my baby when he was about two months and now he is eight, and it is his favorite toy. It’s still surprises me that he has this much interest in it, even now he likes to play with it upside down and it’s just fascinated. I can’t really describe what it is about it that makes it so great but because my son loves it it’s getting five stars.
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingMama

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed! I received the octopus not working!! My little ones were so upset when they could not play with it , at first I thought it was the batteries so I replaced them immediately.. to no avail it still doesn't work. I think I'm going to just get another toy I do not want to receive another defective toy:(
customer_reviews.author: Veruca Salt

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Reason for 4 star is that it was on when it arrived. If the Amazon box was knocked on or shook, you'd hear the music. So good news that it has batteries and works, bad news, the battery life was wasted on the trip over here. Hopefully the post office enjoyed the tunes
customer_reviews.author: Kayla C

customer_reviews.title: Baby Einstein Baby Neptune Ocean Orchestra Musical Toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a baby shower gift because their baby theme was "under water" and since we are all musicians these was perfect. There are two different modes to pick from and they both are good with showing and teaching baby various instrumentation. Baby isn't here yet though, so I don't know how much she'll love it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia Ghent

customer_reviews.title: My 3 month old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 month old loves it! We’ve only had it for a couple of days so I don’t know about battery life or durability but she loves the melodies and the lights! It’s the only way she will do yummy time for more than a few seconds
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sure that I love it more than the grandson
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure that I love it more than the grandson! But he's only 8 months old, so give him time. I didn't realize that it tells you colors and musical instruments in English, Spanish and French...my favorite toy! :)
customer_reviews.author: Nana2Six

customer_reviews.title: Missing a couple of logos, but operates well.
customer_reviews.text: Ours arrived missing the reflective surface on top of its head. Oddly, the photo now shows it without? Regardless, it’s actually an engaging little toy that allows you to interest with the music; isolating 4 different instrument groups. Fun to be had and batteries appear to be lasting a sufficient amount of time. Good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Hutch **

customer_reviews.title: Durable toy my baby loves
customer_reviews.text: I got this toy after seeing that my baby loves lights and music. I wanted something that could grow with her and this does. She is able to play with it on her tummy and while sitting. Two volume levels and the speaker is in the back so it doesn't blast at her. She's been using it for a couple months now and I foresee her using it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: basically a drum with an easily torn cover for a baby
customer_reviews.text: this toy is much ado over nothing. It's basically a drum with extremely thin easily torn cloth over it. There are several buttons with animal faces but they do nothing. If a baby hits the drum they hear random music.
customer_reviews.author: mendolynne

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for baby!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson really likes this toy. He said only 2 1/2 months old but loves to push the different buttons to hear music and see then colored lights. My only complaint is that the purple button lights up red, so we have two red buttons rather than one purple and one red. I don’t know if it’s off-line manufacturing or if just my particular toy was defective. Otherwise the octopus is great fun!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great for a baby that loves music
customer_reviews.text: My six-month old is obsessed with this toy. We have another Baby Einstein octopus toy that she loves so I took a chance and bought this one, and I'm so glad I did. First he helped with tummy time, and now that she's a little older, he's great for when she sits. She loves the orchestra setting which just plays music but also really likes the language side too. I'll be looking for more octopus toys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this toy. We probably got a good 8+ months of use out of it. We bought it when he was around 4 months old and he loved it well past a year. Also probably the most tolerable noise-making toy we have. Update: got the turtle out of storage a couple months ago ahead of baby #2’s arrival. Our now 3 year old is again obsessed with the turtle and has been playing with it for months. He now understands the different features and isolates the different instruments. We have definitely gotten mileage from this cute little fella.
customer_reviews.author: CRR&3

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful (Non-Annoying) Musical Toy!
customer_reviews.text: My son has loved this toy since he was about 4 months-old. Each of the buttons are large, brightly colored, light up, and, most importantly, are easy to press. Since my son doesn't have to apply much force to activate the music, he enjoys it much more than the similar. Personally, I think the music sounds a bit better (less tinny) on the Mozart Magic Cube, but the fact that he can more easily play with this one, and that it's lighter (he can actually pick the turtle up), means I'd recommend this one more for a younger baby.
customer_reviews.author: MelWalker

customer_reviews.title: Educational- classical music, 3 languages and colors!
customer_reviews.text: As a grandmother this is one of the best toys out there for your baby. I bought three of these- one for my 3 month old grandson, one for a 1 year old’s birthday and one for my house! Educational- colors in 3 languages, classical songs, volume control, and colorful!
customer_reviews.author: Annette Jackson

customer_reviews.title: cute
customer_reviews.text: our son loves looking at this. lots of lights and fun music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good toy for a gift or just to have at home
customer_reviews.text: The octopus has been great for promoting tummy time and encouraging sitting and playing. The buttons are easy to hit for my 6mo old so he stays engaged with the toy for a while. The songs and music don’t get old it’s just classical music.
customer_reviews.author: Long Island

customer_reviews.title: my 5 month old loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful interactive toy with lots of music options and the baby can customize his own tune. The multi languages of colors and instruments is great too. Really wonderful toy that continues to entertain my child after 2 months of having it. He eats everything and its sturdy for that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanna

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Loves it
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it cause it plays music and at 9 months that is an excitable thing.. i love it cause when he tosses it about it does not break or come apart... was larger then i thought too which is great....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Baby Neptune's musical style toy.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an autistic child who opened his gift and his face lit up with great pressure. He is non-verbal and expresses himself through different gestures and grunts.
customer_reviews.author: SIDSCat

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful gift
customer_reviews.text: I am cautious about gifting anything that makes noise. This toy makes pleasant and tolerable music and babies are quite intrigued with all the lights and sounds. This is a good choice toy.
customer_reviews.author: Trains

customer_reviews.title: and there's a good variety in the songs
customer_reviews.text: My 7-month-old daughter LOVES this toy. This is her only light-up toy, and she really enjoys pushing the buttons to get them to light up. She claps in time with the music, and there's a good variety in the songs, which are all classical pieces. I like that there are two settings--one that just plays the songs when the buttons are pushed, and one that allows the kid to add/subtract instruments, like the harp or drums, depending on which buttons are pushed. I think that will help prevent her from getting bored with this toy as she gets older.
customer_reviews.author: Babina

customer_reviews.title: Purple is red and red is red
customer_reviews.text: It's great for the most part but the purple color glows red, which I'm worried may confuse my child when they get older. Why couldnt you put a purple light in the purple drum? Maybe it's the OCD in me but.. come on!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra M

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: Our granddaughter who's 3months loves it. She sees us touching the musical instruments and is trying to mimic us. I'm sure she'll love it even more when she can play with it by herself.
customer_reviews.author: retiredRN

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is not 8 months but has loved this thing since 4/5 months. It started with me holding her in my lap and her touching, then she started to roll over to it and lay on her tummy and tap a button or two. Then she began to sit up and Army crawl to it. She like to add the instruments and take them away. When a song is playing you just tape and instrument and it takes that sound out of the song, tap again it adds it again. The instruments playing light up when they are playing. All the songs are popular classical pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Very fun for my 4 month old
customer_reviews.text: We just got this and have had it one day and he loves it! He hits all the buttons! Its covered with buttons all over so everything he touches lights up with sound. There's also a little drum on top so it's cute to hear the drumming
customer_reviews.author: Maryann Olson

customer_reviews.title: Good music
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 4 month old daughter and she doesn’t seem interested in it now but she’ll look at it and listen to the music while playing with her other toys. It lights up and plays a a lot of songs and plays each intstrument when pressed. super cool and fun
customer_reviews.author: Kas1290

customer_reviews.title: Classical Turtle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 6 month old grandson. The music tabs are easy for him to push and kick to get music. It is mostly random now, but it keeps him entertained and the quality of the classical music is good. The only strange thing is the face mask on the turtle's head - it should do something - everyone comments on how strange it is - one design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: My

customer_reviews.title: She seemed to enjoy it a lot
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for a friend's child. She seemed to enjoy it a lot. The plus is that it's not a child's toy that has annoying sounds that play repeatedly. Only thing is that it says "try me" with a button to press but it either had no batteries or they weren't working anymore on arrival (not a huge deal)
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great musical toy
customer_reviews.text: snippets of classical music are played separately by instruments or together depending on which button is pressed. So much nicer than so many electronic toys.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Pinafore

customer_reviews.title: Octopus Orchestra
customer_reviews.text: It is very cute but the one I received was battered and I sill have to return it. Otherwise I would have kept it. Has good sound and nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia McCargo

customer_reviews.title: For the baby who loves lights and sounds
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves music and lights so this is perfect for him. He is almost 3 months so it is nice that this toy is touch sensitive so he doesn’t have to press very hard for the music to play.
customer_reviews.author: JU

customer_reviews.title: We love this toy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It has great sound, it isn't one of those super annoying beepy noise makers. It plays actual music, and the features are cool. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Angela HarrisTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Awesome toy for my wild child
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! My son sits and plays with it for long periods of time. He throws it around and chews on it sometimes and it’s held up so far (had it for 3 months maybe). This definitely keeps him occupied which is hard to do because all he wants to do is move around. Love this!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Fun for babies AND adults!
customer_reviews.text: I think my husband and I might like playing with this toy even more than our 5 month old does. The lights and music hold her attention, and she’s easily able to bang on the buttons herself. I only wish it had a few more songs!
customer_reviews.author: Ro81

customer_reviews.title: Great Developmental Toy
customer_reviews.text: This has been a tremendous learning tool for our baby. She loves interacting with the toy. It is very strong and resilient. It was recommended by our physical therapist.
customer_reviews.author: Peter V.S.. Bond

customer_reviews.title: cute
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an 8 mo. old, hope likes it for xmas.. Looks good so far. Don't know how the battery is gonna last it was playing in the box when I opened it.. ugh. but all in all looks to be a cute toy.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Great toy to keep her busy!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic purchase and well worth the money to keep my little teething 6 year old occupied. It immediately stops her crying when she is fussy, she becomes mesmerized by the lights and music. The music is not annoying no matter how many time she hits the buttons, thank goodness! Buttons are easy enough for her to push as well. Not sure what the thing on the turtle’s head is though, a hat?
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Gilreath

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My 4 month old loves this toy. Just what we expected. Lights are bright enough to keep him entertained as well as the music. Hope this lasts him for a while
customer_reviews.author: Nick. C

customer_reviews.title: Cute thing
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice, with two modes and volume changing. Easy to push buttons. When it plays the buttons blinks different colors. Recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute toy and the music is not annoying. Baby Einstein has the music part down! This toy is a bit cumbersome, however. And I thought the little part on the head was a mirror, which would be great since the child is looking down on it, but it is not. Still a great sound maker, however.
customer_reviews.author: S. Welch

customer_reviews.title: My daughter’s new favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a win for parents! It has two volume settings like a lot of music toys, but the soft setting on it is so soft you almost can’t hear it if you’re not right there. My daughter likes to push the button all day long so it’s great that the rest of us can barely hear it. When we do notice it, it’s playing soothing classical music. She loves it and the rest of the family does too.
customer_reviews.author: Tara L. Rowley

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed
customer_reviews.text: First time that I'm disappointed with an Baby Einstein Toy. The box was broken and fixed with tape! And the quality of the plastic is really bad. The sound isnt good also. I'm not going to return it but I wont keep it neither, so sad...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not made for newborns but my newborn loves it!
customer_reviews.text: As every parent knows, not many newborns enjoy toys. But from day one my daughter loved lights and music so I quickly purchased this and couldn't be happier. It has made an otherwise unenjoyable tummy time experience enjoyable. My daughter loves to watch the lights and coos every time the the turtle is turned on. And from a parent's perspective, the selection of songs doesn't make it nearly as annoying as some of the other toys out there. Great product that'll surely grow with my child.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: An introduction to classical music!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson. I loved it so much, I'm tempted to buy a second one so he can enjoy it whenever he visits...or I can enjoy it every day!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Long

customer_reviews.title: The product is a wonderful addition to a childs toy collection and provides hours ...
customer_reviews.text: The tunes and lights are an attention graber. The product is a wonderful addition to a childs toy collection and provides hours of entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Baby Einstein turtle toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter when she was a few months old because of the music and lights. She is now turning 1 in a few days and is still playing with it. I would definitely recommend this toy to anyone with a baby or small child that loves music and lights. Although I wish the hat on the turtle was a mirror or something. Would have been pretty cool :) but that doesn't change my 5 star rating any.
customer_reviews.author: Sami

customer_reviews.title: You Octopus 🐙
customer_reviews.text: According to my granddaughter my little great-grandson loves his new toy. Doesn't want to let go of it.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. I got the octopus. Not as colorful as I’d like. Plays in several languages no way to turn that off. Lights are dim. Octopus is flimsy. Not the best baby Einstein product at all.
customer_reviews.author: JenniferTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Christmas for my 4 1/2 month old son, and his 2 1/2 year-old brother loves it too! I love the idea of being able to mix and match the different instruments in the ensemble. The sounds are still fairly synthesized and don't sound all that much like the actual instruments they represent, but it's still cute. The classical themes are nice and the piece is holding up well 3 months later. Still haven't had any problems or had to change batteries just with almost daily use!
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hesitate, just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this toy! My daughter is 6 months old and can’t get enough of this toy. It helps keep her occupied during tummy time and isn’t obnoxiously loud. Highly recommend this toy as I foresee her loving it well into the future as it has features for older babies but is entertaining enough for now too!
customer_reviews.author: A. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves it and I do too
customer_reviews.text: My little guy likes the lights and pressing the buttons, while mama finds herself humming the tunes throughout the day as well as singing along while baby is playing. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: jstars

customer_reviews.title: Baby Einstein "Neptune" musical toy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this musical toy for my granddaughter when she was only a couple of months old, and she has loved it! The buttons are easy to push, and when the music plays the buttons light up. We turned the TV to Sirius Symphony Pops network, and I keep the volume low when I babysit, and at 7 months she now sings and directs the orchestra! The Baby Einstein toys are the best! Classical music is so soothing to babies, and this way we don't have the constant TV distractions. The toy is a little cumbersome for little ones, but regardless I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancee

customer_reviews.title: Good toy for little kids
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves everything with lights and music, it is a little bright but great as well !
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Looks used
customer_reviews.text: Received this in very generic box, no instructions and the only packing material was a thin sheet of plastic. The toy looked like it was used and had some scratch marks on it and batteries inside when in the description it stated does not come with batteries. I feel like if I payed $20 for this it should be brand new.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: 9 Month Old Loves It
customer_reviews.text: I don't love plastic toys. I thought my 9 month old was on the same page with me about this for the first few days, but in the end, she has come to love this little turtle. Now, when she is playing with her toys, she stops periodically to press the buttons so she has music to accompany her hard work, and she dances along to it. Because this is one of the cutest things I have ever seen, I am willing to overlook the plastic. Oh, and I like the classical selections!
customer_reviews.author: luu

customer_reviews.title: Cute but...
customer_reviews.text: Received the orchestra octopus in the mail today, I was excited to introduce it to my little one... however the “purple” button will not work. All other buttons light up and say the color/instrument except the purple one, it does nothing. It is super cute and I believe my son would love it but I’ll be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Schindler

customer_reviews.title: Engaging, my kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: My twins love this turtle! It is very engaging with the different instruments and colors. The only thing I dislike is that the legs and head are made out of hard plastic which hurts. They should definitely make it with softer material or hard rubber.
customer_reviews.author: E. Shabtai

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Our baby loves this. He got it when he was about 5 months old and would just look at it. Now that he is 8 months he will intentionally hit the keys, and seems to enjoy the music! It makes him laugh. We actually enjoy the music as well. Unlike some of his other musical toys that can get annoying at times!
customer_reviews.author: Mar211

customer_reviews.title: randomly whacking the poor turtle at four months
customer_reviews.text: My kiddo (6 months) is obsessed with this toy - and his interest in it has grown as he has. Whether it was chewing on the turtle's feet at 3 months, randomly whacking the poor turtle at four months, or pressing and playing with particular favorite buttons these days, he has always loved this toy and lights up when he sees it. Plus, I gotta be real - I enjoy this thing too! It's really cute to be able to add and remove instruments from the composition of famous works - as a music nerd, I find it really entertaining to play with this with my kid.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great fun toy
customer_reviews.text: Now this toy is great. My grandson enjoys it. Loves it actually. Octopus head moves side to side. The colors on the keyboard are bright enough for babies eyes. The sound is good. Not annoying loud. This was a great toy for him.
customer_reviews.author: lmart

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome toy we were introduced to at our son's Autism ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome toy we were introduced to at our son's Autism testing result day. Our daughter absolutely loved it, so we came home and ordered one. Both of the children absolutely love it now. The first one we bought was defective, so we got a free replacement that fully works and it's such an awesome toy. My daughter will spend hours playing with it. My son will spend awhile with it too.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect! The music is clear and the lights light ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves the lights and music! She was 3 months old when we bought this, and was beginning to want to reach and touch and hit her toys to make them play. This is perfect! The music is clear and the lights light up with each music note. Definitely a great toy!
customer_reviews.author: rannd

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not new
customer_reviews.text: This product appears to be used. It was not secured with the zip ties when I received it, all three of the zip ties were cut. The product has surface scratches all over it. Lastly I am not sure if the octopus head is suppose to move but the toy that I received the head remains stationary regardless of the button pushed.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney L.

customer_reviews.title: One bad note ruins the toy
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this, but there is one note on the toy that vibrates like there’s a short in the toy somewhere. Didn’t save the packaging to return it - but that one off note is really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Aratay

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase great quality
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old loves this toy! You can just let the music play or you can choose which instruments you want to hear. Very clever put together toy
customer_reviews.author: Cecile

customer_reviews.title: Daughters love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 6mos old loves this toy and my 6yo even likes playing with it some! The top of the head looks like a button, but it’s not—seems like a missed opportunity! But a great toy for littles!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bright and colorful
customer_reviews.text: bright colorful just what a baby needs to keep interest
customer_reviews.author: R. McKay

customer_reviews.title: This Toy Makes Me Wish I Was A Baby
customer_reviews.text: This was a purchase for my baby granddaughter, and it was a winner. She loves it and it is her go-to first choice when she visits granny. It is so appealing.
customer_reviews.author: SusanTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Daughter loves it. Lights and noise like any baby loves!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Happy with my purchase, however, the power was on before I had even opened the box you could hear the music. The unit is attached to the packaging and the power button is underneath so it’s not possible it got turned on during shipping. I purchased this for our angel tree at work for an infant in foster care.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best Toys
customer_reviews.text: Grandson got this from our best friends when he was born. He played with it so much. So when one of my Best Friend's daughter had her baby, I got it for him. It's a favorite for between 2 months and 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: So Cal Gal

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves!
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient that it comes with battery, but I didn't like how it came with the on/off button on and you could hear it playing before opening the box. Bottom line -5star for the beautiful lights, many music, and most importantly baby approves
customer_reviews.author: anngroteske

customer_reviews.title: Very fun
customer_reviews.text: The buttons are easy to press. Bright lights and fun music captures my 9 month old's attention.
customer_reviews.author: mrheight11

customer_reviews.title: Little Guy Loves it (6 months old)
customer_reviews.text: Our 6 month old loves this toy, he's just sitting up and loves to smack things with his hands. The toy is really pretty cool, I even played conductor with it and added/removed instruments as the songs went along. I think we'll get good use of this one - for now he likes to smack it, but I can see as the baby gets older he'll enjoy even more listening to the individual instruments both separately and together.
customer_reviews.author: KP

product_meta.title: Baby Einstein Music Explorer Musical Toy with Lights and Melodies, Ages 3 months +
product_meta.description: Style:Music ExplorerMusic knows no limits, and neither does this 360-degree baby music toy. Your little one can become a one-man-band with three touch-sensor instruments. Tap the drum, play the piano keys, and rock out on the guitar. Colorful lights set the stage for your baby’s concert, while the baby-safe mirror encourages self-discovery (and so baby can enjoy her own show!). With an easy-to-grip handle, your songwriter can take her favorite instruments wherever she goes.
feature_bullets: A whole band fits right in baby’s hand
Touch-activated drum, guitar and piano sounds
Easy-grip handle means baby can play on-the-go

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,490 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
